sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: Peter of Ickham OSB, Richard of Cirencester OSB, Martin of Troppau OP etc.
P. de Ickham, Ric. Cicestrensis. Martinus Polonus, etc.
msDesc.p: Vellum and paper, 201 141 , 8 x 5.8, ff. 31 + 114, two volumes. Cent. xv, in rather current hands.
Collation: 18 (+1*) 28 38 46 | 510 68-118 1214 (outer and middle sheets vellum, rest paper) 1310 (wants 10: same construction) 1410 1512 1612 (wants 12). 14-16 constructed as 12.

head.title: Tables of certain chronicles and on the burial places of the saints
Tabulae quaedam chronologicae et de locis sanctorum

msItem.ab: On pp. 2, 3 in a small current hand a list of dates
msItem.incipit: Anno ab orbe condito usque ad urbem rome conditam IIII ml ccc xlvij
msItem.ab: ending with 1415
msItem.explicit: Eodem anno fuit bellum de ajincorth
msItem.ab: On p. 4 in the same hand
msItem.incipit: In primis sacrum corpus uirginis marie in valle josaphat fuit sepultum Sancti Johannis euuangeliste corpus in epheso fuit tumulatum sed postea ubi deuenerint eorum corpora satis nobis tradit ecclesia. Aput sebasten .i. samaria Julianus apostata S. Johannis baptiste igne cremauit ossa, etc. Notices Rome, Canterbury, Marseilles, les Stes Maries, St Maximin, etc.
msItem.explicit: Katerina iacet in monte syna manu leuata angelica
msItem.incipit: Reges Christiani. Imperator romanorum. Rex Almannie, etc.
msItem.explicit: Rex boemie, Rex armenie, Rex cipre
msItem.incipit: Cantabrigia a Cantabro regis hispanie filio et gwenebrigia eius sponsa
msItem.explicit: philosophos conuocans ab athenis uniuersitatem cantabrigie fundauit

msItem.head: Peter of Ickham OSB, Compilatio de gestis Britonum et Anglorum

head.title: Epitome chronicorum Angliae ad annum 1429 [per Petrum de Yckham]

msItem.ab: In a better hand, 31 lines to a page
Headed
msItem.rubric: Cronica grece latine temporum series cronos grece tempus latine dicitur
msItem.ab: Begins with verses

lg.l: Albion est terra constans in finibus orbis
( )t quia non solum audiendis sacre scripture verbis aurem

msItem.ab: Ends p. 62 with the Parliament at Westminster
msItem.explicit: per milites parliamenti et comitatus regni Anglie duas integras xvd., etc.
msItem.ab: See nos. 194, 339. Hardy III 271
Note from Bale on Richardus Cicestrius follows

head.title: Chronicle (possibly based on Richard of Cirencester OSB,, Speculum historiale de gestis regum Angliae)
Abbreviatio Ricardi Cicestrii monachi Westmonast. vel Anglo-saxonum chronicon. Desinit in anno 1265

msItem.ab: Title (xvi early?)
msItem.rubric: Abbreuiatio ricardi cicestrii monachi Westmon. (erasure) speculum historiale
De prodicione Vortigerni et quomodo se fecit regem
msItem.incipit: Defunctis Constantino patre constantis aurelii ambrosii et uter pendragon et sancto gwotellmo per prodicionem Vortegerni consulis
msItem.ab: pp. 71-74 have lists of kings
msItem.explicit: anno sequenti mortuus est iste henricus Edwardo existente in terra sancta (1272)
msItem.ab: Hardy III 161 says If this has any connexion with Richard of Cirencester, it is probably only a slight abridgment.

msItem.head: Martin of Troppau OP, Chronica pontificum

head.title: Martini Poloni chronicon de pontificibus Romanis, ad annum 1278 cum additamentis ad annum 1316

msItem.ab: Chronicon Martini
msItem.incipit: Post passionem domini anno sequenti beatus petrus apostolus filius iohannis
msItem.ab: Ends p. 138 after John XXI (hic multum fouit clericos)
msItem.rubric: Explicit cronica fratris martini ordinis predicatorum
msItem.ab: Text continues with Nicholaus IIII and ends p. 139 with John XXII
msItem.explicit: in illis partibus saracenis pro defencione fidei christianitatis instituit
msItem.ab: blank

msItem.head: Martin of Troppau OP, Chronica imperatorum
msItem.ab: (beginning imperfectly: see below)
msItem.incipit: Nero imperator imperauit annis xiii mens. vij
msItem.ab: The text is disordered. It runs to Otto III
Then at p. 161
msItem.incipit: Non arbitror infructuosum seriem temporum huic operi inserere
msItem.ab: From Adam to A. U. C. 426, death of Alexander the Great
msItem.explicit: Hic breuitatis causa multa bella romanorum pertranseo
msItem.incipit: Anno ab urbe condita dco lixo Julio cesare et marco consulibus
msItem.ab: After p. 170 the text of 141-160 should follow
On Churches and Indulgences of Rome
msItem.incipit: Notandum quod in urbe romana sunt cccc et lxvij ecclesie parochiales gratia et sanctitate
msItem.explicit: In hospitali sanctus spiritus vij anni et tot xle et vija pars

msItem.head: Guido de Columnis, Historia destructionis Troiae
msItem.ab: (Guido de Colonna abridged)
msItem.explicit: thelagonio in suo recessu muneribus et diuiciis ampliando
msItem.rubric: Explicit obsidio troie. Finis belli troiani
msItem.ab: pp. 217-222 blank
